Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 23 Sep 2018As always, start reading up first before beginning your investment journey and do not invest in something blindly. All investments carry risks so the money that you invest should be the amount of money that you're willing to lose should anything happen. Thus, set up an emergency funds/savings first before investing. To start off, you can consider the STI ETF or robo-advisors0 comments0

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 22 Sep 2018Learn some basic account and learn how to read financial statements! Understand some of the financial ratios commonly used. Also, don't get swayed when people tell you xxxx stocks will be making big money soon. Base your decisions on your own research!0 comments0
